name.text: Calculating the Volume of a cuboid

questiontext.text:
A cuboid has the following dimensions:

  • Length: {@L@} cm
  • Width: {@W@} cm
  • Height: {@H@} cm

The diagram below represents the cuboid (not drawn to scale):

[[jsxgraph]] // Extract STACK variables var L = {#L#}; var W = {#W#}; var H = {#H#}; var offset = W; // Offset for the back face // Dynamic bounding box var board = JXG.JSXGraph.initBoard(divid, { boundingbox: [ -1, H + offset + 1, L + offset + 2, -1 ], axis: false, showCopyright: false }); // Helper: hidden fixed point function hiddenPoint(coords) { return board.create('point', coords, { visible: false, fixed: true }); } // Front face points var A = hiddenPoint([0, 0]); var B = hiddenPoint([L, 0]); var D = hiddenPoint([0, H]); var C = hiddenPoint([L, H]); // Back face points var E = hiddenPoint([offset, offset]); var F = hiddenPoint([L + offset, offset]); var Hpt = hiddenPoint([offset, H + offset]); var G = hiddenPoint([L + offset, H + offset]); // Helper: fixed edge function edge(P, Q) { return board.create('segment', [P, Q], { fixed: true, strokeWidth: 2 }); } // Draw edges edge(A, B); edge(A, D); edge(B, C); edge(D, C); edge(E, F); edge(E, Hpt); edge(F, G); edge(Hpt, G); edge(A, E); edge(B, F); edge(C, G); edge(D, Hpt); // -------------- DIMENSION LABELS -------------- // Length label (L) along AB board.create('text', [L/2, -0.5, L + " cm"], {fixed: true, anchorX: 'middle'} ); // Height label (H) along AD board.create('text', [-0.5, H/2, H + " cm"], {fixed: true, anchorY: 'middle'} ); // Width label (W) along AE (the slanted depth edge) board.create('text', [offset/2, offset/2, W + " cm"], {fixed: true} ); [[/jsxgraph]]

Find the volume of the cuboid in cubic centimetres (cm³).

[[input:ans1]] [[validation:ans1]] [[feedback:prt1]]

generalfeedback.text:
Worked Solution

The volume of a cuboid is found by multiplying its three dimensions:

\[ V = L \times W \times H. \]

In this problem, the cuboid has dimensions:

  • Length: \( {@L@} \) cm
  • Width: \( {@W@} \) cm
  • Height: \( {@H@} \) cm

Therefore, the volume is:

\[ V = {@L@} \times {@W@} \times {@H@} = {@V@}\text{ cm}^3. \]

So the correct answer is {@V@} cm³.

prtcorrect.text: Correct answer, well done.

prtpartiallycorrect.text: Your answer is partially correct.

truefeedback.text: Your answer is negative, which is not possible for a volume.

qtest.description: Test case assuming the teacher's input gets full marks.
